Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, I want to share with

you a delicious recipe for my Mojo Roasted
Chicken.

The Mojo Roasted Chicken or Grilled Chicken
in just a marinade is sort of like a traditional

Cuban dish, this is by no means traditional,
this is my take on it, but it is so delicious,

it is so flavorful and it is just magnificent,
and you can do this in the oven like I'm going

to do today, because it's pouring rain outside
or you can do this on your outdoor grill.
Either way it would be delicious.

Let me run you through the list of ingredients
you'll need for the marinade for the chicken
which is everything you'll need really.

What I've got in here are some bone-in skin-on
chicken thighs and some chicken drumsticks,

I prefer the skin-on bone-in for this but
you can do like a boneless skinless thighs
or you can do chicken breast if you want to.
If you're going to put it on the grill.

You need oranges, lime, lots of cilantro,
fresh oregano, lots of garlic, salt, pepper
and olive oil and that's pretty much it.
It's really easy and simple, but it is phenomenal.

The combination of the orange and the oregano
and the lime and everything together is just

absolutely insanely good, so what we are going
to work on next now that that's in there.

I'm going to zest and juice the lime and the
orange right in here because I'm going to

have to add this to my little mini chopper
so might as well do all of that here in this
one bowl and then we'll add it all together.
Beautiful.

Do not throw these away because those I'm
going to chop up and put right in a roasting
pan later to roast alongside.

Alright, now you're going to add all of this
to your mini food chopper.

Look how much juice came out, that lime was
so small, but so mighty.

believe it.
Get that all in there.

Going to add some olive oil, about a quarter

A good healthy pinch of salt, this is the
only time that you're using to actually salt
your meat so make sure it's well salted.
And then just get it going.

You can keep going until it's completely smooth
and pureed, but I kind of quite like it chunky,

so some of the herbs pop out, and plus this
is going to marinate for a long time so it's

going to absorb all of that amazing flavor
so just make sure that you coat the chicken
in all of it's marinade.

And then you're going to cover this with some
plastic wrap and pop it into the fridge I'd

say for about a minimum of 6 hours, but really
overnight, this would be wonderful, just make
sure it's all coated.
